abstract: Microsoft and Yahoo are the latest companies to join the effort to equalize the cost of health benefits for employees with same-sex partners.
snippet: Microsoft and Yahoo are the latest companies to join the effort to equalize the cost of health benefits for employees with same-sex partners.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

lead_paragraph: With open enrollment season in full swing, several big companies have said that they would begin to reimburse gay employees for the extra taxes they pay on health insurance for their significant others. Now, two more technology giants, Microsoft and Yahoo, have decided to join in, starting Jan. 1.

headline.main: Microsoft and Yahoo Equalize Health Benefits for Gay Employees
